quoteFirst: I then went into my Closet and received Lord Melbourne there. He stayed with me till
quoteLast: . He seemed and said he was better. He has such an honest, frank, and yet gentle manner. He talks so quietly. I always feel peculiarly satisfied when I have talked with him.

quoteLast: , on July 9th, met with heavy machine-gun and rifle fire.

quoteFirst: It took only twenty minutes to get from New York to her house. He set out at a few minutes after three; arrived at
quoteLast: . As experience of her ways had taught him that she was much less friendly when he disobeyed her requests, he did not dare go to the house, but, after looking at it from a corner two blocks away, made a detour that would use up some of the time he had to waste.

quoteFirst: The 'Héros' continued in her position, giving and receiving a severe fire for nine minutes, and then stood on, greatly damaged, to attack the 'Monmouth,' at that time engaged with another of the enemy's ships, making room for the ships in his rear to come up to the attack of our centre, where the engagement was hottest. At three the 'Monmouth' had her mizzen-mast shot away, and in a few minutes her mainmast, and bore out of the line to leeward (C, c); and at
quoteLast: the wind unexpectedly continuing far northerly without any sea-breeze, and being careful not to entangle our ships with the land, I made signal to wear and haul by the wind in a line-of-battle on the larboard tack, still engaging the enemy.
title: The Influence of Sea Power Upon History, 1660-1783

quoteLast: the embarkation was complete. Men could, hardly realize that the work was accomplished without a terrible disaster. Restraint was thrown aside.

quoteFirst: When dressed he went out into the cabin, closing the door upon his berth, and for lack of anything better to do, seated himself on the thwartships transom, against the forward bulkhead, behind the table. Above his head a chronometer ticked steadily and loudly, and, being consulted, told him that the time of day was
quoteLast: ; which meant that he had slept away some eighteen or twenty hours. That was a solid spell of a rest, when he came to think of it, even allowing that he had been unusually and pardonably fatigued when conducted to his berth.
title: The Black Bag
author: Vance, Louis Joseph, 1879-1933; Fogarty, Thomas, 1873-1938 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: The bailiff, after obtaining each man's telephone number and the message he wished to have sent to his home (if any), informed the jurors that he would be waiting just outside if they wanted him and then departed, locking the door behind him; whereupon the foreman looked at his watch and announced that it was
quoteLast: . This statement resulted in the first disagreement. No two watches were alike.

quoteLast: , the bugles were sounding in the Egyptian portion of El Hejir camp. It was nearly an hour later before réveille went in the British lines and the Lincolns made us think of our sins and forswear all sleep by playing their awakening air, "Old Man Barry." By 5 a.m., Major-General Hunter's division of four brigades, with bands playing, were streaming out of their zereba openings and taking the broad, well-worn tracks across the sand and gravel ridges towards Um Terif.
title: Khartoum Campaign, 1898; or the Re-Conquest of the Soudan
author: Burleigh, Bennet, 1840?-1914

quoteFirst: That was all there had been to it. It had taken him twenty minutes to walk the mile--he knew it, because the hermit’s clock had pointed to
quoteLast: when he left the shanty. Suddenly the blood in the tramp’s jugular leaped violently. Yes, the clock had certainly pointed to twenty minutes to four--and if so--it must have--_must_ have stopped--run down or something--at the very moment the old man died!--And he, Skinny, was the only person alive who knew it,--for he was the only person who knew positively that it had been going just before the murder.
title: The hermit of Turkey Hollow
author: Train, Arthur Cheney, 1875-1945

quoteFirst: Then Zachariah contrived one for himself, which was taken possession of by Noah, after a mimic battle. Esmeralda put the things away, and all took their siesta, while we made two sketches and entered up our diary. At
quoteLast: our party were again _en route_ down the valley.
title: Tent life with English Gipsies in Norway
